These findings collectively highlight the potential for zoonotic pathogen spillover from E. helvum to humans, with routes of infection being via urine
12 , faeces
13 or the hunting and preparation of bat meat for food
14 . However, no such spillovers have been reported for LBV or African henipaviruses. This might be because spillover has not yet occurred, or it might reflect poor medical surveillance capabilities in much of Africa, and the lack of availability of specific diagnostic assays
15 .
